thread.title: BREAKING: 'Imminent' Nevada dam break warning sparks emergency evacuation of 50,000 people
thread.title_full: BREAKING: 'Imminent' Nevada dam break warning sparks emergency evacuation of 50,000 people

title: BREAKING: 'Imminent' Nevada dam break warning sparks emergency evacuation of 50,000 people
text:
ALERT: Around 50,000 people are estimated to live in the region 
The National Weather Service in Reno, Nevada, is urging people to evacuate immediately. 
Authorities believe the dam, about 85 miles northeast of the Reno-Lake Tahoe area, could burst within an hour. 
At least four feet of water is expected to lash the East Dayton area of Nevada in the next three hours. 
NWS Reno have described the failiure as "an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation". 
According to a 2010 census, more than 50,000 people live in the region. 
WEATH AUTHORITY WARNING: The dam is expected to burst within two hours 
Stricken residents have been told to flee to higher ground immediately. 
The flash flood warning will remain in effect until 6:40pm PTZ (2.20am UK time). 
It comes just days after a huge US dam failure triggered the evacuation of 180,000 people in northern California. 
MORE TO FOLLOW
